title: 250 million years ago: permian life in Australia
creator_credit: Australian Museum, Harold Fletcher and Lex Halliday
brief_description: The permian deposits found most notably in the Kimberley’s, North-West Basin and the Hunter Valley are some of the world’s richest fossil deposits. Mostly marine, but some fresh-water and land strata fossils are included. Typical fossils such as butterfly shells, starfish, lace coral, as well as plants and coal seams are highlighted.
